section.p: As a prerequisite for installing the OpenStack Extensions, the operator must have installed the offline resources.
To install the OpenStack extensions for , proceed as follows:

li.p: Log in to the Control Machine.
The installer uses Ansible group variables for configuration purposes. The group variables are located in the /opt/FJSVsvcmm/group_vars directory.
Open the all_group file with your favorite editor. It defines the main configuration settings.
Example:
The installer creates OpenStack user accounts for working with . For this purpose, specify your access credentials for the OpenStack Keystone service in the Keystone Admin credentials section:
Example:
li.codeblock: # Keystone Admin credentials keystone_admin_token: ADMIN keystone_admin: 'admin' keystone_admin_project: 'admin'
li.note: If ADMIN authentication is disabled for the OpenStack Keystone service, keystone_admin_token: ADMIN must be removed.

ol.li:
Provide the passwords required for installing the OpenStack extensions. They are defined in the credentials.yml file that is located in the /opt/FJSVsvcmm directory.
Open the credentials.yml file with your favorite editor.
Example:sudo vim /opt/FJSVsvcmm/credentials.yml

li.p: Specify the following passwords in the file:

ul.li: keystone_monasca_operator_password for Keystone access of the operator. The user account for the operator is automatically created with the installation.
keystone_monasca_agent_password for Keystone access of the user used for configuration purposes of the Metrics Agent. The user account is automatically created with the installation.
keystone_admin_agent_password for Keystone access of the user used for configuration purposes of the Log Agent. The user account is automatically created with the installation.

keystone_admin_password of an OpenStack user account that already exists, for example, admin. This user account is used for creating the new user accounts with the installation. It is the user account of the OpenStack operator.

li.p: Specify your region name for the OpenStack Keystone service. The region name is defined by the keystone_region parameter in the /opt/FJSVsvcmm/roles/monasca-keystone/defaults/main.yml file.
Open the main.yml file with your favorite editor.
Example:
Adapt the keystone_region parameter in the file to your environment.
Example:
To install the OpenStack extensions, specific configuration settings are required. They are specified in the group_vars/openstack_group file.
The file contains the default configuration. No changes are required.
li.note: Make changes only if you have to deviate from the default.
li.p: To view the default configuration, you can open the file with your favorite editor.
Example:
By default, the installer creates the following users, roles, and projects in OpenStack:
A operator who is to monitor .
User name: monasca-operator. Assigned user role: monasca-user and admin. Assigned OpenStack project: monasca.

A user for configuration purposes of the agents used for monitoring . It is recommended that this user account is used only for the agent configurations and not for monitoring and log management tasks.
User name: monasca-agent. Assigned user role: monasca-agent. Assigned OpenStack project: monasca.
The OpenStack operator who is to monitor the OpenStack platform uses the existing admin user account.
Assigned user role: monasca-user and admin. Assigned OpenStack project: admin.

A user for configuration purposes of the agents used for monitoring the OpenStack services. It is recommended that this user account is used only for the agent configurations and not for monitoring and log management tasks.
User name: admin-agent. Assigned user role: monasca-agent. Assigned OpenStack project: admin.

li.note: The roles that are created by the installer must be authorized for accessing the Service. If you change the default configuration of the user accounts, contact your operator. He is responsible for configuring the Service.

Example:
li.codeblock: PLAY RECAP ******************************************************** horizon-node : ok=34 changed=21 unreachable=0 failed=0 keystone-node : ok=21 changed=3 unreachable=0 failed=0
li.note: There are checks performed during installation that may result in failures or warnings. These failures and warnings are reported but they do not block the installation. It is only this final message that is relevant for a successful installation.
